metadata.title: CVE-2021-29974 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - medium
metadata.description: When network partitioning was enabled, e.g. as a result of EnhancedTracking Protection settings, a TLS error page would allow the user tooverride an error on a domain which had specified HTTP Strict TransportSecurity (which implies that the error should not be override-able.) Thisissue did not affect the network connections, and they were correctlyupgraded to HTTPS automatically. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 90.

criterions.comment: firefox: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needed').
